author: costin
msg: Add the binary version of mx4j, for easy compilation. I really hate
requiring people to download/install dozens of packages.
If jmx.jar is defined ( as in 4.x build.xml ) it'll be used, so it's
easy to override if you don't like 'jars in cvs'.
( I usually don't like binaries in cvs, but it seems common practice and

author: costin
msg: Initial code for the (experimental for now ) JMX support for jk.
This is the first step in enabling JMX support for the C components
and the remote native jk ( there is still a _lot_ of work for this to
work ). However all java side jk components should magically become
Of course this is not enabled by default nor finalized ( there are lots
of debug infos ). Just some code that may sit in the jar, unused.

author: costin
msg: Added a definition for the mx handler, to make it easy to configure.
